title: The Future of Tech
key_views: AI agents will likely drive their adoption across industries.
AI is expected to transform the programming landscape, shifting from traditional coding to AI-powered programming.
AI, augmented reality (AR), and automation will be crucial for enhancing revenue through personalized customer experiences and optimizing operational costs.

We believe there is a huge opportunity for companies to offer full-stack quant solutions and AI agents to asset managers, enabling a much faster adoption within the industry.
concerns: CONCERNS; MAN+MACHINE MODEL TO BECOME BIGGER, BUT HUMANS NOT TO BE REPLACED BY MACHINES The low adoption of AI models for investment strategies has been driven by some key concerns.
concern around trusting a model completely (especially when there are still problems of hallucination) would persist, making the future of Gen AI in asset management still a man+machine model.

concerns when the models are trained on relevant data and relationships that make economic sense; most importantly, it solves for the talent problem as the bar to use Gen AI tools is quite low — with a simple statement written in English, one can create effective codes and/or financial analysis.

title: The Nonasphere of Automation

title: From Coin to Compute - The Bitcoin Investing Guide
key_views: ain Bitcoin bulls and continue to expect Bitcoin price to touch a cycle high of 2025 $200K by 2025, led by a new institutional cycle and immutable limited supply (Exhibit 3).

We believe Bitcoin today signifies several intersecting trends — a digital asset hitting mainstream institutional adoption, Bitcoin’s evolving role in energy infrastructure, innovation in energy- efficient mining chip design, AI data center opportunities for Bitcoin miners, and leveraging Blockchain tech for financial innovation.
predictions: we expect Bitcoin to triple from here to attain a cycle- high price of $200K by 2025 end.

title: Artificial Intelligence - Getting Smarter
key_views: AI growth will likely be strong.

AI in asset management is low, but we expect AI to take higher mindshare and investment dollars going forward.

title: The Tech Side of Automation
key_views: we believe, justifies the seemingly high multiples of high-quality automation companies, many of which trade at over 2x PEG and a premium to consumer tech companies with similar growth rates (see Exhibit 6).
winners_losers: benefiting from downstream trends disproportionately? What type of automation companies — incumbent leaders, mid-tier followers, or emerging technology startups — are most worth investing in? These questions lead us to focus, in this Blackbook, on the tech side of automation — an expanding frontier — and its role as an enabler of downstream innovations.

title: Artificial Intelligence in China
key_views: we believe AI will make a major impact in China, namely, healthcare, automotive, surveillance, and automation, to explore AI's position and progress in them.
AI will make a major impact in China, namely, healthcare, automotive, surveillance, and automation, to explore AI's position and progress in them.
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IN CHINA Will China lead the world in AI by 2030.
AI will not only provide the much- needed boost to China's economy, but also address many social problems caused by the lack, and the imbalance, of resources.
AI will disrupt existing industries and companies in China, while creating new opportunities.

title: Artificial Intelligence
key_views: AI will be big in the cloud, providing a strong growth opportunity for winning chip vendors, but with relatively limited impact on leading- edge wafer demand.
AI algorithms and architectures will deliver enough efficiency improvement to limit the growth of leading-edge silicon/wafer demand to a minimum.

we believe technology advancements, through both AI optimization techniques and Moore's Law, will allow us to meet requirements with a much smaller silicon area, as small as 16mm2 per car for level 4 or 5 ADAS in 2025.

AI will have a minimal impact on leading-edge manufacturing and wafer demand, advocating that performance optimization and natural constraints will limit the growth of silicon content, while the other defends the idea that AI is revolutionizing the value chain, promoting new high-value use cases linked to compute-intensive data processing, driving fresh demand for leading-edge silicon, both for logic chips (processors) and memory.
concerns: concerned that semiconductors would capture a limited share.

title: Global Automation - From a Cyclical to a Secular Growth Stor
key_views: we believe investors should be more cautious in timing industry cycles for the traditional industrial automation stocks — for example, Rockwell Automation (currently rated underperform) or Emerson (market-perform), which remain highly cyclical due to their large capex-intensive installed bases.

we think things are different this time: We are envisioning an era where automation enters a long-term secular growth phase — which is part of a long-term technology cycle in automation that is just beginning.
